TopicTitle: [1.6.1] RealPlume - Stock [v1.3.1 - 1/14/19] - Better Late than Never Update

Articles.Content:

I don't think hydrogen produces a blue flame under any circumstances. normally varies between almost colorless and pinkish red, when burned with oxygen.

The Holy Blue Text blesses you with an update

Does this no longer have version checking? I have KSP-AVC and I couldn't help but notice that after I updated this mod it said that there was 1 less mod to check and after skimming through the list of mods it had checked, I didn't see this one in the list.

Sorry if this has been asked/answered somewhere before, but are the smaller, LV909 engines supposed to be silent? they are the only engines in my game that have no sound with this installed, so I was just wondering.
Has anyone ever seen this issue before..? It seems the plume is way too far forward. If you need any details about mods I have installed or anything let me know.

4 hours ago, Nhawks17 said:

Possibly, I don't know much about the mod but from looking inside the download it looks like you should be using his configs over mine if you're using the mod. So try deleting the RealPlume-Stock folder and see if that fixes it?

Darn, I removed the "RealPlume-Stock" folder and it didn't appear to resolve the issue, which means this isn't on your end. Sorry for the trouble.

36 minutes ago, CoriW said:

Darn, I removed the "RealPlume-Stock" folder and it didn't appear to resolve the issue, which means this isn't on your end. Sorry for the trouble.

What you're seeing looks like an issue that was fixed in RFStockalike 3.1.0.

Several releases of RFStockalike just before the current version had you install "RealPlume-RFStockalike" under GameData/RealPlume instead of to its current location directly under GameData. If you upgraded RFStockalike from 3.0.0 or 3.0.1, you may still have an old RealPlume-RFStockalike there.

The older versions run in a later ModuleManager pass, so they will override the current version if both are present. If you have both GameData/RealPlume-RFStockalike and GameData/RealPlume/RealPlume-RFStockalike, try deleting the latter.

2 hours ago, undercoveryankee said:

What you're seeing looks like an issue that was fixed in RFStockalike 3.1.0.

Several releases of RFStockalike just before the current version had you install "RealPlume-RFStockalike" under GameData/RealPlume instead of to its current location directly under GameData. If you upgraded RFStockalike from 3.0.0 or 3.0.1, you may still have an old RealPlume-RFStockalike there.

The older versions run in a later ModuleManager pass, so they will override the current version if both are present. If you have both GameData/RealPlume-RFStockalike and GameData/RealPlume/RealPlume-RFStockalike, try deleting the latter.

Alright so I completely deleted, re-downloaded, and re-installed both RealPlume and RFStockalike. Unfortunately the issue still persists.

EDIT: To clarify I also checked the folders you mentioned to make sure there wasn't another "RealPlume-RFStockalike" in the "RealPlume" folder.

Edited July 11, 2016 by CoriW

Just now, CoriW said:

Alright so I completely deleted, re-downloaded, and re-installed both RealPlume and RFStockalike. Unfortunately the issue still persists.

Sorry. Reading too fast. If you were running RFStockalike and the engine looked like vardicd's screenshot with no plume at all, the fix in 3.1.0 would have fixed that. Your setup with RFStockalike is the other screenshot with the plume showing up but too far forward.

I'm doing some work on RFStockalike plume configs now. I'll take another look at the 909, and if I end up moving the plume farther back on the engine I'll share the fix here.
Mod seems to be working fine, but I get no thrust effect for the ion drive.

Every time I start the game, I'm informed there is a newer version of this mod, but redownloading doesn't fix it. I think the version number didn't get updated in the most recent update, and the update notifier program is being confused. Just wanted to let you know. Love the mod otherwise.

Here's an update that should fix KSP-AVC alerts!

Edited August 5, 2016 by Noman

I wanted to voice a long standing grudge against a stock smoke trail feature that I fear is present in RealPlumes Stock as well :/ - During rocket launches at higher speeds in atmosphere (~200 m/s), the smoke trails don't exit engine bells in the direction of thrust - they leave in the direction of retrograde, making them veer sometimes upwards of 30 degrees off to one side of the engine bell if you perform a gravity turn quickly and often meaning it doesn't come out of the back of the rocket plume but off to one side as well. I'd post a video of this if I wasn't at work.

You can see what I mean by launching any regular rocket into the air and then performing a sudden gravity turn in the upper atmosphere.

- I've been quietly fuming about this for a while now but haven't voiced up because I haven't been sure about the best way to fix this. I think that increasing the speed that the smoke trails leave the engines would fix this. Mind you it isn't the rocket plume that's frustrating, it's the smoke trail that doesn't leave the engine in the right direction.
